user.title: Connect to Sigenergy Energy Storage System
user.description:
Set up a Sigenergy Energy Storage System to monitor and control it through Home Assistant. 

Make sure the Sigenergy system is connected to the same network as Home Assistant and the Modbus option has been enabled by the installer.

dhcp_plant_config.title: Configure Sigenergy Plant
dhcp_plant_config.description: A new Sigenergy device was discovered at {ip_address}. Select your configuration options:

data.keep_existing: Keep Existing Sensors (and potentially rename new ones)

data_description.read_only: (Prevents Home Assistant from making changes to the Sigenergy system. Recommended for initial setup. Can be changed later in device settings.)
data_description.keep_existing:
If you have previous configurations for this device, adding it again might create duplicate or numbered sensors (e.g., `sensor_name_2`).

RECOMMENDED PATH: Leave this unchecked and manually delete any old Sigenergy YAML configuration and related sensor entities in Home Assistant *before* submitting. This ensures new sensors use standard names.

ALTERNATIVE PATH: Check this box to keep existing sensors. No cleanup is needed beforehand, but new sensors with conflicting names will be automatically numbered. You can manage/rename sensors later in device settings.

accumulated_energy_config.title: Accumulated Energy sensor values
accumulated_energy_config.description:
Reset the accumulated energy sensor values (e.g., energy totals) on SUBMIT. 

Enter values in kWh.

plant_config.title: Reconfigure Sigenergy Plant
plant_config.description:
Update the connection details and scan intervals for this Plant.

High Priority Scan Interval is used for Power and Energy sensors.
Alarm Scan Interval is used for Alarm sensors is usually set to same as Medium.
Scan intervals mut be a multiple of the High Scan Interval.
